Ten years after the invasion of Naboo, the galaxy is on the brink of civil war. Under the leadership of a renegade Jedi named Count Dooku, thousands of solar systems threaten to break away from the Galactic Republic. When an assassination attempt is made on Senator Padme Amidala, the former Queen of Naboo, twenty-year-old Jedi apprentice Anakin Skywalker is assigned to protect her. In the course of his mission, Anakin discovers his love for Padme as well as his own darker side. This is the second prequel to the original Star Wars trilogy takes place ten years after the events of Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace. Nice action, great duels. Fun & exciting. Poor acting though and the CGI animation was still in the infancy stage. It was fun watching Anakin as a hot tempered impatient teenager. LoL.

A must have DVD for your Star Wars collection. Review Title: Great movie. Great Star Wars scenes. I love scifi but many films and stories just can't cut it. I thought I would not even get through the first episode. But the more I watched it the more interesting it got. Each episode is its own story, but is also connected to the people and events of all the other episodes. The last eposide really got to me and was in tears. No spoilers, watch them all. The only dislike or warning is: no true details or explanations given for many things that happen in this show. very little true back stories or explanations.
If you found my review helpful, kindly vote below so I can improve my future reviews. Review Title: Slow burn, but worth watching Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: My Spy Review Date: 2020/09/18 Categories: Young Adult Audience, Comedy, Charming, Optimistic Product Description: ['My Spy follows JJ, a hardened CIA operative (Dave Bautista), who has been demoted and finds himself at the mercy of a precocious 9-year old girl named Sophie (Chloe Coleman) after he is sent undercover to surveil her family. In exchange for not blowing JJ’s cover, Sophie uses her charm and wit to convince him to spend time with her and teach her to be a spy.'] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Italiano', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'Italiano', 'Nederlands'], 'Directors': ['Peter Segal'], 'Producers': ['Peter Segal', 'Chris Bender', 'Jake Weiner', 'Robert Simonds', 'Gigi Pritzker', 'Dave Bautista', 'Jonathan Meisner'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Chloe Coleman', 'Ken Jeong']} Review Text: My Spy is a fun "movie of the week" type flick. Its a light, action, and amusing family comedy (with a bit of too much violence for younglings).
JJ is a hardened CIA spy that has been demoted and finds himself at the mercy of a precocious 9-year-old girl, named Sophie where he has been sent undercover begrudgingly to surveil her family. Despite his reluctance, JJ finds he is no match for Sophie's disarming charm and wit. There has been many similiar such stories before, but I found this one a bit refreshing & cute. Keeps you entertained throughout the film. I do recommend. Review Title: Fun watch for the whole family Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/18 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Wellington', 'Steve DiMarco', 'Peter Wellington', 'Gregory Smith', 'James Genn', 'John Fawcett', 'Kelly Makin', 'T.W. But my wife and I were thrilled and couldnt get enough of it. I dont wont to write any details or spoilers of the story, but I do wish they would have explored a bit more about the ghost life ( why he was there, what was the purpose, etc ) as it is an important part of the storyline. Love Charlie and Alex together and Dr Shahir is very funny as well.
Like many shows, there isn't too much you can go with the storyline or charachters. Enjoyed it as long as it lasted. Review Title: Excellent Show Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/18 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['David Platt', 'Constantine Makris', 'Jonathan Kaplan', 'Peter Werner', 'Donna Deitch', 'Jonathan Demme', 'Adam Bernstein', 'John David Coles', 'Eriq La Salle', 'Peter Leto'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: A GIFTED MAN is a drama about a brilliant, charismatic surgeon whose life changes forever when his deceased ex-wife begins teaching him the meaning of life from the “hereafter.” Overall, a really good show and a decent limited series. To bad it didnt last into other season. If you like Ghost Whisperer, Saving Hope, and other simliar shows, you may like this one too. Review Title: Nice show, worth watching - even for one season Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/18 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Tom Ellis', 'Lauren German', 'DB Woodside']} Review Text: Watching Archangels intermingle with humans is quite interesting. There are so many cop shows today to choose from. Many of them are pretty simliar in style type murder. I was a late comer to this show, but glad I started binge watching them. This series has a new Fresh twist for a crime show. The characters are amazing and there is great chemistry between Lucifer & Chloe. Tom Ellis as Lucifer is absolutely brilliant!!! His humor is infectious, and his relationships with the other characters are unique. The writers seem to deviate from the standard known text of bibles and religions and adjusts them to fit their narrative. Which I feel is a good thing. Its fun tv, not bible accuracy. Every episode comes up with an amazing plot and a moral value, which helps Lucifer learn more about human beings and of course His Dad.

Tasteful, respectful, and charming as this show is, its most definately entertaining.

Review Title: Fresh twist for a crime show Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Invisible Man (2020) Review Date: 2020/10/07 Categories: Science Fiction, Suspense, Anxious, Harrowing Product Description: ['"The Invisible Man" stars Emmy® winner Elisabeth Moss ("Us," "The Handmaid\'s Tale") as a woman who fears she is being hunted by the unseen presence of her abusive ex (Oliver Jackson-Cohen).'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Leigh Whannell'], 'Producers': ['Jason Blum', 'Kylie Du Fresne'], 'Starring': ['Elisabeth Moss', 'Aldis Hodge', 'Storm Reid']} Review Text: This is another remake of a 120 year old movie originally written by H.G. Wells and is nothing alike. Many have attemted to rewrite the story based on this interesting concept. Elisabeth Moss performs her part very well, as she plays the victim again just like Handmaids Tale. The beginning of the movie is a slow burn, but eventually picks up on the suspense. Very little character development with no emotional connection to the main characters to make you care what happens to them. Overall, it was entertaining to watch for free, but not if you have to rent it for top dollar. Review Title: Was expecting at least a little more. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/10/20 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Sonequa Martin-Green', 'Doug Jones', 'Anthony Rapp', 'Mary Wiseman', 'David Ajala', 'Wilson Cruz'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: Sequels and spinoffs are very dissicult to pull off. Some shows and movies did not quite hit the mark. But I feel that CBS has continued the torch for us Star Trek fans. I have been watching Star Trek since the 1970's and some spinoffs did not do it for me. Discovery Season 1 was a fresh take in the Star Trek experience and still trekking steady as she goes into its third season, with episode one done very well. I guess this story line no feels familiar a bit to Star Trek Voyager being lost in a diffrent universe or time. I have confidence that this season will continue to entertain us Trekies.

Live long & Prosper Review Title: CBS bodly going where no network has gone before! Kelly', 'Juno John Lee', 'Jason Zurek', 'Kim Arndt', 'Bob Suarez', 'Michael Mullen', 'Fill Marc Sagadraca'], 'Producers': ['Aaron Baiers', 'Robyn Johnson', 'Heather Kadin'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} Review Text: This was was fun and refreshing to watch for kids and adult fans alike. The show was based on Star Trek's The Next Generation episode called “Lower Decks” from the viewpoint of the junior officers on the lower decks of the enterprise. These episodes focus on the low ranking officers on one of the Starfleet’s least important ships, the U.S.S. Cerritos. I will not give away plot details or spoilers as they are already out there.
Overall, its light entertainment from the Star Trek universe. Will like to see more episodes or similiar story lines that they dont do in real films.

Review Title: Fun & Enjoyable for any Trekkie Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/11/24 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Pepe Danquart'], 'Producers': ['Susa Kusche', 'Uwe Spiller'], 'Starring': ['Andrzej Tkacz', 'Kamil Tkacz', 'Elisabeth Duda'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} Review Text: Based on a true story of Yoram Israel Fridman who was smuggled out of the Warsaw Ghetto at age eight. This is the tale of an eight-year old boy who escapes the Warsaw Ghetto and for three years survives on his own in Nazi-occupied Poland could easy defy belief! Run Boy Run is a film well worth watching and showing the true horrors of the Holocaust and World War II. Without giving away any storylines or spoilers and you can stomach this heavy drama filled movie, it is a must see. I like when these types of movies focus on one family or person, as it shows the individual struggle to survive during that time. My mother and father both survived and told me stories of such horror, so I can relate very well as they were young children during the war as well. Review Title: A must see film. Abby returns to her hometown after hearing troubling news about the family inn facing foreclosure in the series premiere of this drama about a divorced mom dealing with her past. Chesapeake Shores is good, clean family show. The family is not perfect and have their struggles to deal with, and this is what gives the show its accuracy.
The series puts a high value on family and healthy relationships. Adult couples embrace and kiss, and in some scenes they drink beer or wine.
This feel-good drama is a great choice for teens and adults alike. Appropriate for ages 11 and up. I did watch the whole film and it did keep me interested, so I have to say it wasn't a bad film, just cheaply made. Dagfinnsson', 'Jules Daly', 'David Ellison', 'Bradley J. Fischer', 'Dana Goldberg', 'David S. Goyer', 'Don Granger', 'Hjortur Gretarsson'], 'Starring': ['Chris Pratt', 'J.K. Simmons', 'Yvonne Strahovski']} Review Text: This is a creature feature -- and the monsters are fanged, spiked, and terrifying. Expect guts being blasted everywhere. I expected a cheesy sci fi film, but in the end I found it a bit entertaining. There is Lots of green alien blood and missing limbs. There is action, humors, sci fi, war, and some warm emotional moments. Overall, a nice paced film with a decent ending as far as a sci fi film can go. Overall, characters are from all walks of life and make positive contributions with the skills they have, including women who are assured leaders and kids who love science.
Not for younger kids, or people who are a bit squeamish. Parents should also know that there is foul language as well. 👽👽👽 Review Title: 👽👽👽 Action, aliens, guts, and more... 👽👽👽 Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/12/27 Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Frank Capra'], 'Producers': ['Frank Capra'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Donna Reed', 'Lionel Barrymore'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} Review Text: George Bailey as portrayed by James Stewart is the kind of everyman hero we can all identify with. He's got the everyday problems to be sure, raising and providing for a family, but he's got bigger problems than that. Fate has made him the rallying point of opposition in his small town of Bedford Falls to the "richest and meanest man in town", embodied in Lionel Barrymore.
George Bailey (James Stewart) is at the edge of financial ruin. He thinks his life has amounted to nothing and is about to jump off a bridge. An angel named Clarence is assigned to give George a second chance by showing him what if he was never born.

This is an unabashed sentimental tear-jerker. The movie starts with George's life as it is. His dream is to travel the world and create great monuments. He is constantly dragged back to the unimpressive little Bedford Falls and the family Savings and Loans. He is a good guy who constantly does the right thing.
It has its uplifting conclusion and the theme that every life has its purpose in the great scheme of things. What if we had never existed? Review Title: One of the Most Beautiful Movies of the Cinema History Ever Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: Nice show, worth watching - even for one season Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/18 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Tom Ellis', 'Lauren German', 'DB Woodside']} Review Text: Watching Archangels intermingle with humans is quite interesting. This series has a new Fresh twist for a crime show. The characters are amazing and there is great chemistry between Lucifer & Chloe. Tom Ellis as Lucifer is absolutely brilliant!!! His humor is infectious, and his relationships with the other characters are unique. The writers seem to deviate from the standard known text of bibles and religions and adjusts them to fit their narrative. Which I feel is a good thing. Its fun tv, not bible accuracy. He's got the everyday problems to be sure, raising and providing for a family, but he's got bigger problems than that. Fate has made him the rallying point of opposition in his small town of Bedford Falls to the "richest and meanest man in town", embodied in Lionel Barrymore.
George Bailey (James Stewart) is at the edge of financial ruin. He thinks his life has amounted to nothing and is about to jump off a bridge. An angel named Clarence is assigned to give George a second chance by showing him what if he was never born.

This is an unabashed sentimental tear-jerker. The movie starts with George's life as it is. His dream is to travel the world and create great monuments. He is constantly dragged back to the unimpressive little Bedford Falls and the family Savings and Loans. He is a good guy who constantly does the right thing.
It has its uplifting conclusion and the theme that every life has its purpose in the great scheme of things. What if we had never existed? Review Title: One of the Most Beautiful Movies of the Cinema History Ever Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

target_interaction.title: Small stories, big scope
target_interaction.text:
I like this new season and this animated comedy has found a new degree of confidence, both in itself and in its role in the franchise as a whole. While the friendship between Ensigns Beckett Mariner and Bradward Boimler continues to occupy the center stage, this season sees the crew of the Cerritos and the California Class at large further explored. Looking for copious Star Trek allusions, alien sex, and unexpected twists of perspective? Lower Decks season 3 has them all!

"Star Trek: Lower Decks" season 3 finds the animated series, set in the late-"Next Generation" period after the events of "Star Trek: Nemesis," continuing the stride it hit in season two. The jokes are funnier, the characters continuously on-point, and the storytelling, while certainly goofy, very much in-line with the basic tenets of "Star Trek."
